Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Antimicrobial peptide Alo-3 (Alo-3; knottin-type peptide; Insects, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: belongs to the inhibitor cystine-knot family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Candida glabrata patient 1 (MIC=8 µg/mL), C. glabrata ATCC 90030 (MIC=16 µg/mL), C. albicans IHEM 8060 (MIC=16 µg/mL), C. albicans ATCC 36082 (MIC=8 µg/mL).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Alo-3 contains six cysteine residues forming three disulfide bridges. It exhibits all the structural features characteristic of the knottin fold, namely, a triple-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet with a long flexible loop connecting the first strand to the second strand and a series of turns.
Sequence Information.Function: Alo-3 shows a level of activity significantly higher against C. glabrata than Alo-1 or Alo-2.
Sequence Information.Domain: The presence of a disulfide through disulfide knot' structurally defines this protein as a knottin.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of Alo-3 a new knottin-type antifungal peptide from the insect Acrocinus longimanus.
Literature.Author: Barbault F, Landon C, Guenneugues M, Meyer JP, Schott V, Dimarcq JL, Vovelle F.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of Alo-3: a new knottin-type antifungal peptide from the insect Acrocinus longimanus.
Literature.Author: Schott V.,Meyer J.-P.,Guenneugues M.,Landon C.,Barbault F.
